articles.author: Tom Hals
articles.description: The case was brought by Democratic state attorneys general.
articles.title: Judge calls rare hearing on a holiday in case against Musk's DOGE

articles.author: John Irish, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: The acceleration in Ukraine diplomacy means Europe needs to do more and in a better way, a French presidency official said ahead of informal talks later on Monday among several key European leaders in Paris.
articles.title: Fast-moving Ukraine diplomacy means Europeans must do more, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares said European leaders will discuss in Paris on Monday how to prevent a peace negotiation on Ukraine ending up rewarding Russian aggression.
articles.title: European leaders seek to prevent rewarding Russian aggression, Spain says

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel will keep troops in several posts in southern Lebanon past a February 18 deadline for them to withdraw, a military spokesperson said on Monday, as Israeli leaders sought to reassure northern residents that they can return home safely.
articles.title: Israel will leave troops in 5 locations in Lebanon after Tuesday deadline, military spokesperson says

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Doctors have had to change treatment for Pope Francis' respiratory tract infection to tackle a "complex clinical situation" and he will remain in hospital for as long as necessary, the Vatican said on Monday.
articles.title: Pope's treatment changed to tackle 'complex' clinical situation, Vatican says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Greece will soon set up an evacuation port on the island of Santorini to facilitate the safe escape of people in case a bigger quake hits the popular tourist destination, a Greek minister said on Monday.
articles.title: Greece to build escape port on Santorini as quakes continue, says minister

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Families of some Israeli hostages in Gaza have received signs of life from their loved ones for the first time in more than a year via captives who have been freed over the past weeks in the ceasefire deal with Hamas.
articles.title: Freed hostages bring signs of life from depths of Gaza tunnels

articles.author: Angelo Amante, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is clashing with the country's judiciary in the same way her old political ally and mentor Silvio Berlusconi used to, promising a once-in-a-lifetime overhaul of the legal system.
articles.title: Italy's Meloni takes on the judiciary, in echo of Berlusconi

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: The 23-year-old Syrian refugee believed to have killed a teenager and injured five other people in a weekend stabbing rampage in the Austrian town of Villach became radicalised quickly by using TikTok, officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Austrian knife attack suspect was radicalised on TikTok, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Medic and ambulance worker Tarek Rabie Safi said he was underfed and abused during almost a year in captivity.
articles.title: Palestinian detainee says he was tortured in Israeli detention centre
